com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.devicecontrol

Class BulkOperation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.util.ExtensibleObject
      • com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.devicecontrol.BulkOperation

  • public class BulkOperation
extends ExtensibleObject
    BulkOperation represents a BulkOperation in the CoT. Bulk operations are used to create operations for a complete group.

    Created by Patrick Steinert on 02.01.17.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String STATUS_ACTIVE
      Status ACTIVE: when bulk operation is created.
      static String STATUS_COMPLETED
      Status COMPLETED: when the operation was performed on all devices.
      static String STATUS_DELETED
      Status DELETED: when already created operation was cancelled by deleting the bulk operation
      static String STATUS_IN_PROGRESS
      Status IN_PROGRESS: when bulk operation is performing on all devices.

      • Fields inherited from class com.telekom.m2m.cot.restsdk.util.ExtensibleObject

        anyObject

      Constructor and Description
      BulkOperation()
      Constructor to create a bulk operation.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public String getId()
        Get the unique identifier for the bulk operation.
        Returns:
        String with the unique identifier of the bulk operation or null if not available.

      • setGroupId

        public void setGroupId(String groupId)
        Set the groupId of the target group on which the bulk operation should be performed. Group of devices is a managed object from type 'c8y_DeviceGroup' and flagged as 'c8y_IsDeviceGroup'
        Parameters:
        groupId - the unique identifier of the target group.

      • getGroupId

        public String getGroupId()
        Get the groupId of the target group of the bulk operation.
        Returns:
        String with the unique identifier of the target group or null if not available.

      • setFailedBulkOperationId

        public void setFailedBulkOperationId(String failedBulkOperationId)
        Set the bulk operation id to reschedule this operation on devices where it failed.
        Parameters:
        failedBulkOperationId - the unique identifier of the bulk operation.

      • getFailedBulkOperationId

        public String getFailedBulkOperationId()
        Get the bulk operation id from which failed operation should be rescheduled.
        Returns:
        String with the unique identifier of the failed bulk operation id or null if not available.

      • getStatus

        public String getStatus()
        Get the status of the bulk operation.

        Valid values: ACTIVE, COMPLETED, DELETED

        Returns:
        a String with the status

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(String status)
        Set the status of the bulk operation.

        Valid values: ACTIVE, COMPLETED, DELETED

        Parameters:
        status - String which represents the status of the bulk operation.

      • setCreationRamp

        public void setCreationRamp(Number creationRamp)
        Set the ramp up time, specifying the delay between every operation.
        Parameters:
        creationRamp - number in seconds.

      • getCreationRamp

        public Number getCreationRamp()
        Get the ramp up time, specifying the delay between every operation.
        Returns:
        the number in seconds.

      • getStartDate

        public Date getStartDate()
        Get the time when operation should be started.
        Returns:
        Date object representing the timestamp when bulk operation should be performed.

      • setStartDate

        public void setStartDate(Date startDate)
        Set the schedule time.
        Parameters:
        startDate - Date object with the time when bulk operation should be performed.

      • getOperation

        public Operation getOperation()
        Get the operation which will be executed for every device in the target group.
        Returns:
        Operation object representing the operation which will be executed for every device in the target group.

      • setOperation

        public void setOperation(Operation operation)
        Set the operation which should be executed for every device in the target group.
        Parameters:
        operation - Operation object representing the operation which need to be executed for every device in the target group.

      • getProgress

        public Progress getProgress()
        Get the progress of the bulk operation.
        Returns:
        Progress object containing the number of processed bulk operations.

      • setProgress

        public void setProgress(Progress progress)
        Set the progress of the bulk operation.
        Parameters:
        progress - Progress object containing the number of processed bulk operations.
